results.title: Frank film (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Award winning animated autobiography. With two voices reciting autobiographical details over sequences created from images cut from magazines Mouris creates a portrait of his life and the life of America. Collage and the animation of still images are the main visual techniques used in this comment upon materialism. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Francoise
results.creator_credit: Pierre Patry and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An expression of the restless, unsettled spirit of the modern city and the women who have left the quiet home life of the previous generation for the competitive world in todays cities. For Francoise, work was an escape from a domestic role she found hollow and unsatisfying, but a career outside her home was not enough to fill the vacuum in her life. She found success without really wanting it. Her competence as an artist in an advertising agency won the approval of her employer, but also the overt hostility of other employees, both male and female. Cast includes: Jocelyne France, Benoit Girard, Mireille Lemelin, Ginette Letondal, Doris Lussier, Yves Massicotte, Gilles Normand.

results.title: Franco: the story of an immigrant
results.creator_credit: Salvatore Greco, Randall Richardson and Fine Film Productions
results.brief_description: Franco, an italian immigrant employed as a labourer, is doubtful about the advantages of living in Canada. He becomes nostalgic for the old country and makes arrangements to return with his wife and family. An encounter with an old friend helps him to open his eyes to reality.

results.title: Francisco Goya (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions, Sotheby's, Visual Programme Systems and W. H. Smith
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
This film traces the disturbing story of Goya’s career, the changes in which were apparent in his work. His early work depicted light hearted scenes. As a court painter he was one of the most sought after portrait painters in Madrid. After he became deaf he embarked on a series of etchings depicting a world of deformed bodies. Written and narrated by Kenneth Clark.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions, Sotheby’s, Visual Programme Systems and W. H. Smith

results.title: France: background for literature
results.brief_description: Recaptures the France of the stories of Hugo, Balzac, Maupassant and Poe. Showing scenes in Paris, Versailles, Fountainbleau, Orleans, Chateau d’If, Marseilles and Normandy, the film provides a background for existing literature but does not attempt to recreate the actual scenes of stories.

results.title: France and its people
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Depicts the life of a Parisian family, including a visit to the family farm in Normandy. Provides an introduction to the geography, industry, agriculture, customs, religion, art, social and economic problems, democratic traditions and overseas relationships of France. Emphasises the close ties of friendship between France and the United States, and describes French contributions to Western civilisation.

results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 12
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around the French Customs Office and the docks ending with revision of grammar.
